channel.title: Fill In the Blank GUI
channel.description: I'm attempting to create a GUI for my calculator I am making. I want it to pop-up when the program is ran and have 4 options of filling in things. The things you entered in will be set to a variable so I can later use them in calculating. Does anyone know how I would go about doing that? If you can, what is the format for import.etc at the top of most java files and how do I go about using them?

item.title: Fill In the Blank GUI
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“iwasinmoparseas101class, post:8, topic:37217”]basically when working with GUIs you only really need:

import java.awt.*; import java.awt.Event.*; (I think htat's what it is) import javax.swing.*; [/quote]

That should be java.awt.event.;
Be careful that you have java.awt.event.; , because it will let you import java.awt.Event.*; which is a class not a package, and then it will confuse the hell out of you when the compiler says “Cant find symbol: symbol class WindowEvent”.

Read full topic

item.title: Fill In the Blank GUI
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

basically when working with GUIs you only really need:

import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.Event.*; (I think htat's what it is)
import javax.swing.*;

Those will pretty much open up your JFrame to do quite a bit. To store the input as variables just do a lil’ something like this:

int firstItem = <containerName>.getText(); 
//containerName will be the JTextField or whatever and the int will be whatever Primitive or Class Type you are dealing with

imports are merely packages and librarys so you have access to implementations from certain classes.

import ..;

or something like that

Read full topic

item.title: Fill In the Blank GUI
item.dc:creator: @wrolyat wrolyat
item.description:
@wrolyat wrote:

Thanks, I’ve been reading the sun java tutorials on it for days now… lol. It’s so complex and so many different options you can go with.

What is the syntax of the import feature? I am just wondering so I can import different class files that I made and use their voids instead of using the extend feature.

Read full topic
